DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit for intended dose per administration for ECDOSE, ECDOSTOT, or ECDOSTXT.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exposure as Collected Domain Exposure as Collected Dose Units
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected._The unit of measure for the dosage form of the collected exposure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected.

Concepts.definition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected.

Property.preferredDefinition: The unit of measure for the dosage form of the collected exposure.

Concepts.definition: The unit of measure for the dosage form of the collected exposure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC CDASH Units for Exposure Terminology Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A terminology subset of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Unit codelist created for Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Units for Exposure terminology._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to a metered dose of medicinal substance(s) that is delivered in uniform quantity upon each activation of a medical device (e.g. an inhaler), in which the dosage form is contained.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a puff.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to use active NCIt. mc 2/8/19

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of medicinal substance(s) contained in a single item of a tablet dosage form comprising of compressed medicinal substance(s) with or without suitable diluents.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a tablet.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a capsule.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a capsule.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What were the units for the d
ReferenceDocuments.description: What were the units for the dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC CDASH Units for Exposure Terminology
ReferenceDocuments.description: A terminology subset of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Unit codelist created for Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Units for Exposure terminology.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form  Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the unit of dose or amount taken per period recorded (e.g., ng, mg, mg/kg).

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECDOSU
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Unit of dose or amount taken per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose unit must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., determined from protocol, randomization data). The unit should be pre-printed on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. A CDASH Subset Controlled Terminology Codelist Name is available for dose and volume units. In blinded trials, the collected unit may be tablet, capsule, etc., since the actual unit is also blinded.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CTEP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: What [is/was] the unit for the dose?
